member.name: P:CefSharp.SchemeHandlerResponse.CloseStream
member.summary: Set to true to close the response stream once it has been read. The default value is false in order to preserve the old CefSharp behavior of not closing the stream.

member.name: P:CefSharp.SchemeHandlerResponse.RedirectUrl
member.summary: URL to redirect to (leave empty to not redirect).

member.name: P:CefSharp.SchemeHandlerResponse.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of the response contents. Defaults to -1, which means unknown length and causes CefSharp to read the response stream in pieces. Thus, setting a length is optional but allows for more optimal response reading.

member.name: P:CefSharp.SchemeHandlerResponse.StatusCode
member.summary: The status code of the response. Unless set, the default value used is 200 (corresponding to HTTP status OK).

member.name: P:CefSharp.SchemeHandlerResponse.ResponseStream
member.summary: A Stream with the response data. If the request didn't return any response, leave this property as null.

member.name: M:CefSharp.TypeUtils.ConvertFromCef(CefRefPtr<CefV8Value>)
member.summary: Converts a Chromium V8 value to a (managed) .NET object.
member.param: The V8 value that should be converted.

member.name: M:CefSharp.TypeUtils.ConvertToCef(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Converts a .NET object to an (unmanaged) Chromium V8 object.
member.param: The .NET object that should be converted.
The type of the source object. If this parameter is a null reference, the type will be determined automatically.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Cef.Shutdown
member.summary: Shuts down CefSharp and the underlying CEF infrastructure. This method is safe to call multiple times; it will only shut down CEF on the first call (all subsequent calls will be ignored).

member.name: M:CefSharp.Cef.SetCookiePath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the directory path that will be used for storing cookie data. If is empty data will be stored in memory only. Otherwise, data will be stored at the specified path. To persist session cookies (cookies without an expiry date or validity interval) set to true. Session cookies are generally intended to be transient and most Web browsers do not persist them.
member.param: The file path to write cookies to.
A flag that determines whether session cookies will be persisted or not.
member.return: false if a non-empty invalid URL is specified, or if the CookieManager is not available; otherwise, true.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Cef.DeleteCookies(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes all cookies that matches all the provided parameters. If both and are empty, all cookies will be deleted.
member.param: The cookie URL. If an empty string is provided, any URL will be matched.
The name of the cookie. If an empty string is provided, any URL will be matched.
member.return: false if a non-empty invalid URL is specified, or if cookies cannot be accessed; otherwise, true.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Cef.SetCookie(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Sets a cookie using mostly default parameters. This function expects each attribute to be well-formed. It will check for disallowed characters (e.g. the ';' character is disallowed within the cookie value attribute) and will return false without setting the cookie if such characters are found.
member.param: The cookie URL
The cookie name.
The cookie value.
The cookie domain.
The DateTime when the cookie will be treated as expired.
member.return: false if the cookie cannot be set (e.g. if illegal charecters such as ';' are used); otherwise true.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Cef.SetCookie(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Sets a CefSharp Cookie. This function expects each attribute to be well-formed. It will check for disallowed characters (e.g. the ';' character is disallowed within the cookie value attribute) and will return false without setting the cookie if such characters are found.
member.param: The cookie URL
The cookie name
The cookie value
The cookie domain
The cookie path
A flag that determines whether the cookie will be marked as "secure" (i.e. its scope is limited to secure channels, typically HTTPS).
A flag that determines whether the cookie will be marked as HTTP Only (i.e. the cookie is inaccessible to client-side scripts).
A flag that determines whether the cookie has an expiration date. Must be set to true when the "expires" parameter is provided.
The DateTime when the cookie will be treated as expired. Will only be taken into account if the "has_expires" is set to true.
member.return: false if the cookie cannot be set (e.g. if illegal charecters such as ';' are used); otherwise true.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Cef.VisitUrlCookies(System.String,System.Boolean,CefSharp.ICookieVisitor)
member.summary: Visits a subset of the cookies. The results are filtered by the given url scheme, host, domain and path. If is true, HTTP-only cookies will also be included in the results. The returned cookies are sorted by longest path, then by earliest creation date.
member.param: The URL to use for filtering a subset of the cookies available.
A flag that determines whether HTTP-only cookies will be shown in results.
A user-provided Cookie Visitor implementation.
member.return: Returns false if the CookieManager is not available; otherwise, true.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Cef.VisitAllCookies(CefSharp.ICookieVisitor)
member.summary: Visits all cookies using the provided Cookie Visitor. The returned cookies are sorted by longest path, then by earliest creation date.
member.param: A user-provided Cookie Visitor implementation.
member.return: Returns false if the CookieManager is not available; otherwise, true.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Cef.RegisterJsObject(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Binds a C# class to a JavaScript object.
member.param: The name for the new object in the JavaScript engine (e.g. 'foo' for an object accessible as 'foo' or 'window.foo').
The .NET object to bind.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Cef.Initialize(CefSharp.CefSettings)
member.summary: Initializes CefSharp with user-provided settings.
member.param: CefSharp configuration settings.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Cef.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes CefSharp with the default settings.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Cef.ChromiumVersion
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the Chromium version currently being used.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Cef.CefVersion
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the CEF version currently being used.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Cef.CefSharpVersion
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the version of CefSharp currently being used.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Cef.IsInitialized
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether CefSharp is initialized.
member.value: true if CefSharp is initalized; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:CefSharp.CefEventFlags
member.summary: Supported event bit flags.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.CommandDown
member.summary: Mac OS-X command key.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Internals.StringUtils.AssignNativeFromClr(_cef_string_utf16_t*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced,System.String)
member.summary: Assigns the provided cef_string_t object from the given .NET string.

The .NET string whose value should be used to update cefStr.

member.name: M:CefSharp.Internals.StringUtils.ToNative(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a .NET string to native (unmanaged) format. Note that this method does not allocate a new copy of the
member.param: The string that should be converted.
member.returns: An unmanaged representation of the provided string, or an empty string if the input string is a nullptr.

member.summary: Converts an unmanaged string to a (managed) .NET string.
member.param: The string that should be converted.
